alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:36AM CST until January 12 at 12:52PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tallahassee FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Pea River near Ariton (US 231) affecting Dale and Coffee Counties. For the Pea River...including Ariton (US 231), Elba (US 84)...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pea River near Ariton (US 231). * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, The basement of a home on U.S. Highway 231 and the Pea River will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 3.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 15.7 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.8 feet on 01/16/1992. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 245 AM CST.
